text.section:
Schedule I consists of each controlled dangerous substance:
listed in this section;
added to Schedule I by the Department under § 5-202(b) of this title; or
designated as a Schedule I controlled dangerous substance by the federal government unless the Department objects under § 5-202(f) of this title.

section.section: Unless specifically excepted under this subtitle, an isomer, ester, ether, or salt of a substance listed in this subsection or a salt of the isomer, ester, or ether is a substance listed in Schedule I if the existence of the isomer, ester, ether, or salt is possible within the specific chemical designation.

Unless specifically excepted under this subtitle, a salt, isomer, or salt of an isomer of a substance listed in this subsection is a Schedule I substance if the existence of the salt, isomer, or salt of an isomer is possible within the specific chemical designation.

Unless specifically excepted under this subtitle, a salt, isomer, or salt of an isomer of a substance listed in this subsection is a substance listed in Schedule I if the existence of the salt, isomer, or salt of an isomer is possible within the specific chemical designation.

Unless specifically excepted under this subtitle or listed in another schedule, a material, compound, mixture, or preparation that contains any quantity of the following substances having a depressant effect on the central nervous system is a substance listed in Schedule I:
mecloqualone;
methaqualone; and
a salt, isomer, or salt of an isomer of a substance listed in this paragraph if the existence of the salt, isomer, or salt of an isomer is possible within the specific chemical designation.

In this subsection:
"controlled dangerous substance analogue" means a substance:
"controlled dangerous substance analogue" does not include:
To the extent intended for human consumption, each controlled dangerous substance analogue is a substance listed in Schedule I.

text.section:
The Department may not add a substance to Schedule I under § 5-202 of this title unless the Department finds:
a high potential for abuse of the substance;
no accepted medical use in the United States for the substance; and
a lack of accepted safety for use of the substance under medical supervision.
